intro: Agalinis digitalis, commonly known as the slender bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Agalinis digitalis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial.
